div.p: Parish President Robby Miller is in frequent communication with the Louisiana Department of Health regarding the Coronavirus. This page is dedicated to sharing as much relevant information with you, the citizens of Tangipahoa Parish, as possible to ensure you are kept the most up to date.
Below you will find information on the Coronavirus as it relates to various individuals and agencies.

li.a: COVID-19 Emergency Loan Small Business Guide and Checklist
Presumptive Positive Test Results in Louisiana
North Oaks Outlines COVID-19 Response Plan
Northshore Technical Community College Updates page
SBA Disaster Assistance Response to Coronavirus

div.class: eds_news_module_1010 news eds_subCollection_news eds_news_Ozone eds_template_List_Article_Default eds_templateGroup_listArticleDefault eds_styleSwitchCriteria_portalSettingsSource

div.p: Please scroll all the way down to read the daily update for 04-20-20, from GNO, Inc .
We will forward these daily updates on a regular basis in an effort to keep you informed.
You can register for daily webinars for the SBA EIDL Loan & CARES Act-PPP Loan Webinars presented by the Small Business Development Center by clicking here:

p.a: Daily Webinars for SBA EIDL Loan and CARES PPP Act Loan Information

p.u: If you do not desire to receive these updates just let us know and we will remove you from the email group list.

div.p: Thank you and be safe and well for you and yours.
Please scroll all the way down to read the daily update, 04-20-20, from the Louisiana Business Emergency Operations Center (LABEOC).
We are forwarding this information to you as it may be of value to your enterprise or employees.
Click here to Register for daily webinars from the Small Business Development Center at Southeastern Louisiana University:

p.a: Daily SBDC Webinars (Mon. - Thur.) for SBA EIDL Loan and CARES PPP Act Loan Information

div.p: You can register to get these updates direct from LABEOC by clicking here:
You can register to updates directly from Louisiana Economic Development by clicking here:
Register for Louisiana Economic Development Updates
If you do not want to be included in this email group just let us know and we will remove your email address.
Please contact us anytime we can be of any assistance.
Be safe and well for you and yours.
Please scroll all the way down to read the daily update for 04-19-20, from GNO, Inc .
We will forward these daily updates on a regular basis in an effort to keep you informed.
Note: There is a webinar this Thursday on the hospitality industry. (See below.)
If you do not desire to receive these updates just let us know and we will remove you from the email group list.
Thank you and be safe and well for you and yours.

Please go to http://ldh.la.gov/Coronavirus/ for official information on Positive Test Results and locations. It is updated 12 noon daily. LDH officials’ latest report: As of last report all Parishes have reported (64 of 64) cases with state totaling 23,580 cases of COVID-19 and 1,267 deaths across the state.
1,761 Reported COVID-19 Patients in Hospitals; 347 of those on ventilators
6,249 Tests Completed by State Lab; 131,750Commercial Tests Completed

p.strong: SEE ATTACHED SPREADSHEET FOR LATEST PARISH INFO UPDATE WILL BE AT NOON TODAY

div.p: Please scroll all the way down to read the daily update for 04-18-20, from GNO, Inc .
We will forward these daily updates on a regular basis in an effort to keep you informed.

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA). The FFCRA requires employers to provide paid leave through two separate provisions: (i) the Emergency Paid Sick Leave Act (EPSLA), which entitles workers to up to 80 hours of paid sick time when they are unable to work for certain reasons related to COVID-19, and (ii) the Emergency Family and Medical Leave Expansion Act (Expanded FMLA), which entitles workers to certain paid family and medical leave.

p.a: CLICK HERE FOR IRS FAQ & GUIDANCE ON FFCRA, EPSLA & Expanded FMLA.

div.p: More than 80 million Economic Impact Payments have already been delivered to the nation’s taxpayers. More payments are on their way.

p.a: CLICK HERE FOR THE I.R.S. ECONOMIC IMPACT PAYMENT INFORMATION CENTER.
